docs.text:
For full documentation visit Install the Microsoft ODBC driver for SQL Server (Linux).

Configure development environment for pyodbc Python development

docs.title: Microsoft ODBC 17
docs.text:
Ubuntu 
if ! [[ "16.04 18.04 20.04 22.04" == *"$(lsb_release -rs)"* ]];
then
echo "Ubuntu $(lsb_release -rs) is not currently supported.";
exit;
fi

sudo su
curl https://packages.microsoft.com/keys/microsoft.asc | apt-key add -

curl https://packages.microsoft.com/config/ubuntu/$(lsb_release -rs)/prod.list > /etc/apt/sources.list.d/mssql-release.list

exit
sudo apt-get update
sudo ACCEPT_EULA=Y apt-get install -y msodbcsql17
# optional: for bcp and sqlcmd
sudo ACCEPT_EULA=Y apt-get install -y mssql-tools
echo 'export PATH="$PATH:/opt/mssql-tools/bin"' >> ~/.bashrc
source ~/.bashrc
# optional: for unixODBC development headers
sudo apt-get install -y unixodbc-dev

docs.title: Connection
docs.text:
Ubuntu 
DRIVER={ODBC Driver 17 for SQL Server};SERVER=host_name,port;DATABASE=db_name;UID=username;PWD=password

import pyodbc
__connection_str = f'DRIVER={{{self.DRIVER}}};SERVER={self.SERVER},{self.PORT};DATABASE={self.DATABASE};UID={self.UID};PWD={self.PWD}'
cnxn = pyodbc.connect(__connection_str)
cursor = cnxn.cursor()
cursor.execute(query)
